intro: Euonymus trapococcus, commonly known as the red-edged euonymus, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with distinctive red margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 (capsules) that split open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its adaptability and attractive foliage make it a common choice for landscaping in temperate regions.
